history.content: Yes, all technical electives must be upper-division. The website you referenced delineates upper-division requirements, and under that designation, it lists the upper-division courses that count. It does say all undergraduate and graduate courses in physics, math, etc., but that's listed under "Upper-Division Requirements". I imagine they didn't say "all *upper-division* & graduate courses" because it would be redundant and space was very limited in the text field.

http://guide.berkeley.edu/undergraduate/degree-programs/computer-science/#majorrequirementstext

On the website listed above, it says all undergraduate math, physics, etc classes count towards CS technical electives, yet on the eecs.berkeley.edu website, it says that our CS technical electives must be upper-div courses.
history.subject: Do CS technical electives have to be upper-div courses?
